uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.session

Class AbstractRequestFactory<R extends AbstractRequestFactory.AbstractRequest>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.data.DataObjectFactory<R>
      • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.session.AbstractRequestFactory<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - type of request object.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contexed, ContextCached, FormCreatorProducer, FormUpdateProducer<R>, FilterMatcher<R>, TypeConverter<R,java.lang.Number>, DataObjectSelector<R>, Selector<DataObjectItemInput<R>>, Owner<R>, IndexedProducer<R>, Tagged, Targetted<R>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractTargetRequestFactory, AbstractUserRequestFactory

    public abstract class AbstractRequestFactory<R extends AbstractRequestFactory.AbstractRequest>
extends DataObjectFactory<R>
    Abstract class for building request links (with expiry time). If the AppUser the link is for is known in advance use AbstractUserRequestFactory

      • makeTag

        public final java.lang.String makeTag(int id,
                                      java.lang.String seed)
        Generate a new tag used to create the request url. This always contains a random value and an explicit integer id. The random value is generated from a hash of both a random number generator and a Seed value. The seed value should come from the context of the request. It is intended to mitigate against attacks against the random number generator. Both by making it harder to determine random number state by generating URLs and to guess urls (without also guessing/knowing the seed value). The id value specifies an object the request is in respect to. For example a user account being changed. This is to reduce the possibility of a tag clash.
        Parameters:
        id - - Integer id of object owning the request.
        seed - - a String based on the context of the request.
        Returns:

      • getDefaultTableSpecification

        protected TableSpecification getDefaultTableSpecification(AppContext c,
                                                          java.lang.String table)
        Description copied from class: DataObjectFactory
        Get the default table specification if the table is to be created. A null result means that a default specification is not available and the table will not be created.
        Overrides:
        getDefaultTableSpecification in class DataObjectFactory<R extends AbstractRequestFactory.AbstractRequest>
        Parameters:
        c - AppContext
        table - String table name.
        Returns:
        null or TableSpecification
